publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1476 Nick Johnston: W H Smith-That the Parliament notes that WH Smith has announced its intention to reverse its decision to introduce pornography in its high street stores and, whilst welcoming this small step, encourages all high street retailers to review their policies on stocking offensive material.

S1M-1476 Nick Johnston: WH Smith-That the Parliament notes that WH Smith has announced its intention to reverse its decision to introduce pornography in its high street stores and, whilst welcoming this small step, encourages all high street retailers to review their policies on stocking offensive material. Supported by: Brian Adam*
S1M-1476 WH Smith (lodged on 14 December 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1476 WH Smith (lodged on 14 December 2000) Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*
S1M-1476 WH Smith (lodged on 14 December 2000) Linda Fabiani*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1476 Nick Johnston: WH Smith—That the Parliament notes that WH Smith has announced its intention to reverse its decision to introduce pornography in its high street stores and, whilst welcoming this small step, encourages all high street retailers to review their policies on stocking offensive material. Supported by: Brian Adam, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Robin Harper, Linda Fabiani, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Pauline McNeill, Mr Gil Paterson, Mary Scanlon
S1M-1476 WH Smith (lodged on 14 December 2000) Phil Gallie*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1476 Nick Johnston: WH Smith—That the Parliament notes that WH Smith has announced its intention to reverse its decision to introduce pornography in its high street stores and, whilst welcoming this small step, encourages all high street retailers to review their policies on stocking offensive material. Supported by: Brian Adam, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Christine Grahame, Robin Harper, Linda Fabiani, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Pauline McNeill, Mr Gil Paterson, Mary Scanlon, Phil Gallie, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1476 WH Smith (lodged on 14 December 2000) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-1476 Nick Johnston: WH Smith—That the Parliament notes that WH Smith has announced its intention to reverse its decision to introduce pornography in its high street stores and, whilst welcoming this small step, encourages all high street retailers to review their policies on stocking offensive material.
